text: A Y 5. Given the following type definitions in a programming language which uses structural type equivalence: type Tl = struct{ int a; bool b; Y type T2 = struct{ int a; bool b; } type T3 = struct{ T2 u; Tl v; } type T4 = struct{ Tl u; T2 Vv; } In the scope of the declarations T3 a and T4 b, it is claimed that the as- signmenta = b is permitted. Justify your answer.
